intro: Swertia parviflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of alpine flora.
